title: Getting Started
text: Simply add stat_tukey() layer ggplot object. run Tukey test show statistical significance . play around ggplot2::scale_y_continuous() significance marker present.  can use p.format argument change p-values presented. Two common options scales::label_pvalue() scales::label_number_auto().  can also implement function format . function accept double input, return character displayed.  default, stat_tukey perform statistical tests values presented ggplot. , add scale_y_log2() ggplot, statistic results performed log2-transformed y-values. desired behavior, trans_value argument allow apply transformation function y-values running statistical test.   can fine tune aesthetic parameters case look good default.
code: base_plot +   stat_tukey() +   scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion(mult = c(0.1, 0.5))) base_plot +   stat_tukey(p.format = scales::label_pvalue()) +   scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion(mult = c(0.1, 0.5))) my_format = function(x) {   dplyr::case_when(     x < 0.001 ~ "very significant",     x < 0.05 ~ "significant",     TRUE ~  "not significant"   ) }   base_plot +   stat_tukey(p.format = my_format) +   scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion(mult = c(0.1, 0.5))) base_plot +   stat_tukey(p.format = scales::label_scientific()) +    scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion(mult = c(0.1, 0.5))) +   labs(title = "No y transformation") base_plot +   stat_tukey(trans_value = log2, p.format = scales::label_scientific()) +    scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion(mult = c(0.1, 0.5)))  +   labs(title = "Y values transformed before stat test") base_plot +   stat_tukey(text_size = 5, line_size = 0.5, linetype = 2) +    scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion(mult = c(0.1, 0.5)))

title: Getting Started
text: Dunnett test works similar Tukey test. parameter work similarly. One key distinction stat_dunnett() shows p-values top group  different style alignment can used.  want explicitly show comparisons made, use GeomBracket geom.
code: base_plot +   stat_dunnett() base_plot +   stat_dunnett(p.y_align = 2) base_plot +   stat_dunnett(geom = "bracket") +    scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion(mult = c(0.1, 0.5)))

title: Authors and Citation
text: Yuhao Min. Author, maintainer.

code: @Manual{,   title = {ggmulticomp: Layers For Multiple Comparison},   author = {Yuhao Min},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.1},   url = {http://www.myuhao.com/ggmulticomp/}, }

title: Layers For Multiple Comparison
text: ggmulticomp provides several ggplot2 stat layer multiple comparison.

title: Layers For Multiple Comparison
text: can install ggmulticomp like :

title: Layers For Multiple Comparison
code: library(ggplot2) library(ggmulticomp)  dat = iris |>   tidyr::pivot_longer(-Species) |>   dplyr::mutate(     y = value, x = Species   )   dat |>   ggplot(aes(x = Species, y = value)) +   geom_point() +   stat_summary(geom = GeomCol) +   stat_dunnett(color = "red") +   facet_grid(rows = vars(name), cols = vars("a"), scale = "free_y") #> No summary function supplied, defaulting to `mean_se()` #> Warning: Removed 4 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_text()`). dat |>   ggplot(aes(x = Species, y = value)) +   geom_point() +   stat_summary(geom = GeomCol) +   geom_tukey() +   scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.2))) +   facet_grid(rows = vars(name), cols = vars("a"), scale = "free_y") #> No summary function supplied, defaulting to `mean_se()`

title: Plot brackets — geom_bracket
text: Base geom plot brackets pairwise comparisons. Takes location brackets plot segment. Add label. y position bracket automatically increased dodge .

title: Plot brackets — geom_bracket
code: geom_bracket(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   stat = "identity",   position = "identity",   inherit.aes = TRUE,   text_size = 12,   line_size = 1,   linetype = "solid",   ... )  GeomBracket

title: Plot brackets — geom_bracket
text: object class GeomBracket (inherits Geom, ggproto, gg) length 4.

title: Plot brackets — geom_bracket
text: text_size Fontsize, pt line_size Size bracket line linetype Format line.

title: Dunnett's Test — stat_dunnett
text: Perform Dunnett's Multiple Test Reference group. Display adjusted p-values figure.

title: Dunnett's Test — stat_dunnett
code: stat_dunnett(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   geom = GeomText,   position = "identity",   na.rm = FALSE,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE,   ref.group = NULL,   offset = NULL,   trans_value = NULL,   show.ns = TRUE,   p.format = NULL,   p.y_align = NULL,   ... )  StatDunnett

title: Dunnett's Test — stat_dunnett
text: object class StatDunnett (inherits Stat, ggproto, gg) length 4.

title: Dunnett's Test — stat_dunnett
text: ref.group reference group used. Default first level x-axis (sort()) offset much label offset data points. Default 0.1 trans_value function accept vector input output transformed vector. applied y values statistics test. show.ns non-significant results shown? p.format format pvalue display. function accept dbl input, return chr displayed. Default show stars p.y_align number 1, 2, 3 specify p-values presented text_size Size significance symbols, default 12pt line_size Size lines spanning group, default 1pt linetype Type line spanning group

title: Tukey HSD Test — stat_tukey
text: Perform Tukey HSD Test. Display adjusted p-values figure.

title: Tukey HSD Test — stat_tukey
code: stat_tukey(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   geom = GeomBracket,   position = "identity",   inherit.aes = TRUE,   show.ns = FALSE,   trans_value = NULL,   p.format = NULL,   ... )  StatTukey

title: Tukey HSD Test — stat_tukey
text: object class StatTukey (inherits Stat, ggproto, gg) length 4.

title: Tukey HSD Test — stat_tukey
text: show.ns non-significant results shown trans_value function accept vector input output transformed vector. applied y values statistics test. p.format format pvalue display. function accept dbl input, return chr displayed. Default show stars text_size Size significance symbols, default 12pt line_size Size lines spanning group, default 1pt linetype Type line spanning group
